duck: Containment order - In the mathematical field of order theory, a containment order is the partial order that arises as the subset-containment relation on some collection of objects.
subset definition: a set each of whose elements is an element of an inclusive set.
In mathematics, especially in set theory, a set A is a subset of a set B, or equivalently B is a superset of A, if A is "contained" inside B, that is, all elements of A are also elements of B.

wiki.text:
showing
A is a proper subset of B and conversely B is a proper superset of A]] In mathematics, especially in set theory, a set A is a 'subset' of a set B, or equivalently B is a 'superset' of A, if A is "contained" inside B, that is, all elements of A are also elements of B. A and B may coincide. The relationship of one set being a subset of another is called 'inclusion' or sometimes 'containment'.
wiki.title: subset
